column4: I'm running Ubuntu 5.10 64-bit, and I'm having trouble mounting a partition. I type "mount /dev/sdb2 /media/foo" and am told "mount: /dev/sdb2 already mounted or /media/foo/ busy". "mount" doesn't show /dev/sdb2 mounted, and "lsof /media/foo" doesn't show it as being busy. Any ideas?
sudo umount /dev/sdb2
/dev/sdb2 is definitely not mounted
try mounting it to a different mountpoint
I don't seem to be able to mount any partition on /dev/sdb
I've tried different mountpoints, to no avail.
what are the perm's on the mountpoints?
drwxr-xr-x
mount with -fv
-fv output?

I got one of the sysadmins here to take a look, it turns out that EVMS / device mapper has claimed the partitions on /dev/sdb as its own, no idea why but at least I know where I should be looking now.
how did he find that out?
He'd run into something similar before, there are nodes for /dev/evms/sdb[123]
Doing "mount /dev/evms/sdb2 /media/foo" works
I see, Ill have to add that one to my black book of crazies now
Thanks for your help anyway
I still wonder what the output of mount -fv /dev/blah /media/foo would be...
/dev/sd2b on /media/foo type unknown (rw)
Then the partition is shown as mounted, but the contents aren't visible in /media/foo
yes, because it doesnt actually make the system call...
I just did a default install, I didn't turn it on :)
you really have no need for EVMS if you arent running software RAID or some crazy disk configs
I'd not heard of EVMS before it started stealing my disks. I didn't enable it.
I know, I was just saying for your sake =)
